job.title: Network Engineer
job.description: descriptionltbrgtltpgtsemcon provides a highly qualified professional and responsive technical and managerial workforce to satisfy customer requirements that support the federal aviation administration faaampaposs mission vision goals semcons company culture aligns enriching career experiences growth opportunities and collaborative engagement for all employees resulting in a company value being greater than the sum of our partsltbrgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltbrgtltbrgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtwe are currently searching for a network engineer to join our teamltbrgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltbrgtltbrgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtthe network engineer should have advanced knowledge in the following areas ltbrgtltbrgtltpgtltulgtltligtcisco asa routers and switchesltligtltligtnetworking in a virtual environment and with dynamic virtual switchesltligtltligtconfiguring proxy servers and firewalls in secure enterprise networks ltligtltulgtltpgtthe network engineer will provide remote support of branch offices asa routers and monitoring of network equipment and remote upgrades and will support a tier helpdesk including afterhours support as needed experience with akamai content delivery network and cloud architecture is desiredltbrgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltbrgtltbrgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtstrong written and verbal communication skills are required as well as the ability to collect and analyze data and communicate technical information experience in using basic software packages such as ms office suite is desiredltbrgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltbrgtltbrgtltbrgtltpgtltpgta bachelorampaposs degree in engineering math or science and at least years of related work experience is required ltbrgtltbrgtltpgtltpgt ltbrgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtsemcon offers a competitive salary and complete benefits package which includes health benefits medical dental vision and life k with a generous employer match paid time off and paid holidaysltbrgtltbrgtltpgtltbrgtltbrgtrequirements
